title: African Housing Payments App
description: 非公式なアイデンティティと支払い記録は、良好な支払い履歴を持つお客様が将来の資金調達のための信用評価を確立することを妨げます。

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge in that it targets an important use case (building reputation via a verifiable payment history in housing, etc.) that could reach and involve thousands and eventually millions of people, with proposers who work in that specific business environment in two different jurisdictions in Africa. A 'grassroots' approach, starting local and small, that through open-source apps could be shared throughout the African continent to other providers of housing services.  I would love to see this idea come to fruition!
f6_assessments.q1: Given the information in the proposal, I can neither agree nor disagree that the plan presented will likely be implemented successfully. There is no specific information about the collaborators, and even though they are working in the ecosystem proposed, I do not see information in 'Relevant Experience' about how they have the skills needed to see the project through (TAHCo since 2020 is not that long ago either). Also, for me, the budget is sketchy, or lacks detail (10 days/$5000 for a project manager doesn't say much, and seems like a lot per hour). For this much money, 17% of the Challenge Setting budget, I would need to see more detail about the roadmap, the 3, 6 and 12 month goals, and how the team will be spending their time and the community's money.
f6_assessments.q2:
Although the solution to the problem is reasonably well described, I do not see any specifics on measuring success of the intended plan. There is a suggestion about how 'Future Extensions' might look, but there are no specific KPIs or metrics listed as to how we the community can access or audit the progress and success of the proposal. What is the target audience? Who are the potential users of the platform? How will they be onboarded?
Given that the proposers work in the use case environment, I would expect that they could use metrics based on the number of individuals who are part of this ecosystem, etc., expectations of how many could be onboarded, and a 'roadmap' of their plan to execute and bring onboard an expected number of users of the proposed applications/services provided by them.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal when completed would introduce a new community of individuals and business to DID and Atala PRISM therefore I 'Strongly Agree'
f6_assessments.q1:
Having over 25 years in Information Systems, Project Management I have reviewed your Proposal, Team Skills, recommended Website.

I like that you understand your user base as it pertains to their access to information, Mobile applications is best for your customers. Whereas the Businesses that are receiving the information most likely will need both Mobile and Web access to information.

I like that it is open source so it can be adapted to meet other ideas.

Your experience in the affordable housing market is excellent. So I feel you know your community of users well enough to produce a usable product.

On the referenced web page I only saw one individual with and IT / Project Management Background. I cannot tell where you will be getting your programming resources and what experience level they have which makes it difficult to determine if the timeline for coding efforts or cost of effort  is good enough. In my experience many projects underestimate this area so be aware of this.

Given these thoughts I'm assessing 'I Agree' on implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Given that the proposers are developing a Mobile App I believe seeing the product as it progresses will be sufficient to for an audit so I 'Strongly Agree'

f6_assessments.q0: I have some perspective on this proposal having worked in rural Zambia (Lumwana) for several months. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge at hand and also stands in line with the mission of Cardano to bring economic equality to the world. The team have clearly stated the problem that they are proposing to solve with Atala PRISM. They have suggested a solution that would be a gateway to the Cardano Blockchain for millions of people across the continent. The impact of this project being successfully implemented could substantially grow Cardano's user base due to the volume of people effected by the stated problem. The team are based in Africa and demonstrate an understanding of the unique challenges present.
f6_assessments.q1: Due to this team already leading two successful social impact organisations and the high quality of their proposal I think this team has what it takes to bring their vision to life. The team already have established professional networks within several African countries and reference a huge community that would benefit from their solution. I think this would be a good investment of Catalyst funds due to the established team and intention to open source their software. Similar organisations will be able to leverage the progress this team makes to further drive adoption and social good. The budget appears reasonable and an explanation of how the project will become self sustaining has been put forward.
f6_assessments.q2: The team haven't really specified road map details but the tools they are going to use to get there haven't been released yet so I guess they can't get too detailed at this stage. The team have set a three month target for development of their phone dapp this is a solid target we can audit however It would be good if the team could break that down further so the community can be reassured everything is on track. Once the project is live we will be able to measure success by the number of users onboarded and payments recorded on the blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0:
this proposal highlighted a pressing problem in Nigeria and offered a wonderful. solution but unfortunately failed to provide more details as regards to the off-chain captured data and how the data is shared between companies.For sure this will drive a mass adoption of DID.
I agree.
f6_assessments.q1:
the proposal provided given experience but with verifiable link and implementation plan but failed to present more details of the mobile app implementation especially as regards to the handling of off-chain data and its access.I believe this is very key to a proper implementation of the project.
The off-chain captured data can be implemented as an oracle tied by a DID which can cater for the off-chain data capture.
I agree.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal did a great job of providing sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal solution.
I agree.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem statement should be more closely aligned with the challenge but the solution is clear and reasonable.
The goal of using DIDs to create credit histories for those with informal identities aligns with the challenge objective. The Future Extensions are good examples of how the solution onramps to the Cardano ecosystem.
The proposal is able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users. The open source software aspect allowing other regions to use the software is likely to accelerate the scaling effect.
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has not provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links. There is a link to the Tahco website however there is no indication provided as to what relationship the three proposers have to either TAHCo or Casa Real.
The team of has been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal however no details on who will fill those roles are provided.
The budget is reasonable to achieve the goals and is broken down into identifiable items.
The timetable is realistic to complete the work but does not show what is being done and when.
The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal.
The proposal does not identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal does not provide a roadmap with auditable milestones and a defined timeline. This is a total solution provided in 3 months scenario.
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user.
The proposal should detail specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals. This is an open source software project so github could be used to allow auditing of progress for instance.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

solution: CardanoとAtala PRISMを使用して構築された、分散型のIDおよび決済追跡アプリケーション。
experience:
TAHCo:2020年以降、ナイジェリアの手頃な価格の住宅開発をリード

Casa Real：2018年以降、モザンビークのリーディング・アフォーダブル・ハウジング・ディベロッパー。
